news.title: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy linked to reduced depressive relapse risk
news.summary: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy was associated with a reduced risk of depressive relapse over a 60-week follow-up period compared with usual care and outcomes were comparable to those who received other active treatments, according to an article…

news.title: Mindfulness therapy to prevent depression relapse 'on par' with drugs, review shows
news.summary: People who've recovered from depression stave off relapses with mindfulness therapy as well as with antidepressants, a new review finds.

news.title: 'Mindfulness' May Keep Depression from Coming Back
news.summary: Credit: Mooshny | Shutterstock.com View full size image A type of "mindfulness" therapy that helps people become more aware of their emotions may help prevent a relapse of depression, a new meta-analysis finds.

news.title: Mindfulness Therapy May Help Ease Recurrent Depression
news.summary: (HealthDay News) -- Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy may help reduce the risk of repeated episodes of depression, according to a study published online April 27 in JAMA Psychiatry.

news.title: Mindfulness Therapy May Prevent Depression Relapse
news.summary: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) reduces the risk for depression relapse in patients with recurrent depression, with the greatest effect seen in those with the worst baseline symptoms, the results of an individual patient data meta-analysis…
